articles.description: Manchester United's hopes of advancing in the Champions League take a blow as they let a two-goal lead slip against Galatasaray in Turkey.
articles.title: Man Utd let two-goal lead slip in Galatasaray draw

articles.description: Owner John Henry has ended title droughts on both sides of the Atlantic, but neither Liverpool or Boston Red Sox fans are entirely happy with the direction he is taking their teams.
articles.title: Glory and fury - Liverpool, Boston and a tale of two teams

articles.description: Jude Bellingham becomes the first player to score in each of his first four Champions League appearances for Real Madrid as they beat Napoli.
articles.title: Bellingham sets scoring record as Real beat Napoli

articles.description: Arsenal reach the Champions League knockouts for the first time in seven years and top Group B with a thumping victory over Lens at Emirates Stadium.
articles.title: Arsenal win Champions League group with Lens rout

articles.description: Luke Donald says the prospect of joining Tony Jacklin as the only European captain to win home and away Ryder Cups motivated him to stay on as skipper.
articles.title: 'Donald enticed by chance to cement Ryder Cup legacy'

articles.description: Manchester United played out a classic European match with Galatasaray - but goalkeeper Andre Onana's mistakes led to ultimate disappointment.
articles.title: 'Hapless Onana again flouts billing as top keeper'

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says he is responsible for his side's tendency to throw away leads in the Champions League.
articles.title: 'I am responsible' - but Ten Hag vows Man Utd will have success

articles.description: Star New York Jets quarterback Aaron Rodgers is cleared to return to practice just 11 weeks after undergoing surgery on a torn Achilles tendon.
articles.title: Rodgers returning to practice 11 weeks after surgery

articles.description: England Test captain Ben Stokes has surgery to address a long-standing knee problem.
articles.title: England captain Stokes undergoes knee surgery

articles.description: Sergio Ramos scores the 10,000th goal in the Champions League as Sevilla named the oldest starting line-up in the competition in defeat against PSV Eindhoven.
articles.title: Ramos scores Champions League's 10,000th goal
